span.span: Parents and teachers choose Ehrhart for our small class sizes, TEKS based curriculum, fine arts, STEM, and athletics. Currently, we serve students in grades Pre-K through eighth. Ehrhart is accepting applications for our 2020-2021 waiting list. Applications can be picked up in our main office or downloaded here in English or Spanish.

istinctions from the Texas Education Agency for being a Top 25% in Student Progress, Top 25% in Closing the Gaps, Math, and English Language Arts/Reading in 2019. Click here for our Accountability Report.

strong.span: Due to the most recent amended order from Governor Abbott, Ehrhart facilities will remain closed through May 22, 2020. Ehrhart will continue our flexible education schedule through the remainder of the school year. We encourage you to avoid large gatherings and wash your hands. Safety is our top priority at Ehrhart. Apart we stand together! Stay strong Eagles!

Packet distribution will be Monday, April 27th from 10:30 – 12:30. These packets will have school work for the remainder of the year. Please remain in your cars. If you are able to download the packets from our Google Folder, please let your child’s teachers know so they don’t waste paper. If you would like your packet mailed, please contact our front office.

We will pass out lunch and breakfast (for the next day) until we run out each weekday. We can only serve students enrolled at Ehrhart.

span.strong: What You Need to Know About the Coronavirus (English) (Spanish)

Ehrhart has 2020 – 2021 an opening for a bilingual (English/Spanish) Pre-K teacher, PE Teacher/Coach, 6th Grade Teacher, 2nd Grade Teachers, and Special Education (Inclusion) Teacher. Click here to view our Certified Teacher Salary Schedule (Certified Bilingual teachers make an additional $9,000 in yearly stipends! Qualified applicants click here to apply online.

a.b: Click here to view a KFDM news segment regarding Ehrhart.

span.strong: We appreciate everything our Board of Trustees do to support our students, parents, and staff at Ehrhart.

span.span: The Ehrhart School is a Title I school. This means that more than 50% of our students are eligible for free or reduced-price lunches. Title I is a federal program that gives additional money to schools that qualify this way. All students are benefited by this money which helps us to enhance instruction for all students.

em.span: The Ehrhart School does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex or disability in providing education or providing access to benefits of educational services, activities, and programs, including vocational programs, in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Educational Amendments of 1972; Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended; and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act.The Ehrhart School does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex or disability in providing education or providing access to benefits of educational services, activities, and programs, including vocational programs, in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Educational Amendments of 1972; Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended; and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act.
